info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 4:56AM CDT until June 17 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...EASTERN GREENE...MADISON...MACOUPIN AND JERSEY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...ST. CHARLES AND ST. LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 455 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Athensville to Greenfield to near Old Kane to 8 miles west of Orchard Farms, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported power outages across several towns and a National Weather Service employee estimated 60 mph gusts. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Greenfield around 500 AM CDT. Grafton around 510 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Florissant, Hazelwood, Berkeley, Palmyra, Elsah, Portage Des Sioux, Kemper, Ferguson, Carlinville, Brighton, Calverton Park, West Alton, Bellefontaine Neighbors, Black Jack, Spanish Lake, Castle Point, St. Louis, Godfrey, Virden, Girard, Shipman, Glasgow Village, Alton, Wood River, Madison, East Alton, Bunker Hill, Hartford, Bethalto, Pontoon Beach, South Roxana, Roxana and Rosewood Heights. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, Beaver Dam State Park, and Horseshoe Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 55 in Illinois between exits 23 and 44. Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 261 and 277. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 216 and 231. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
